original: Almquist, Ernst Carl Henning, fÖT-ste fartygsinspektör, Kailmar, f. 19/9/ 97 i Södertälje landsförs. av godsäg. Johan A. o. Anna Boheman. G. 24 m. Else Almgren. Barn: Margareta f. 25, g. m. flyging. J. O. Arman, Birgitta 27, Styrbjörn 28. — Stud:ex. v. nya eikm islk. i St’h’lm 15, avgiex. fr. KTH (’sikeppsbyggn.) 20. — Anst. v. Maatschappij Fijenoord i Rotterdam 21-32, Wilton Fijenoord i Schiedam 32-33, konstr. h. marinförv. i Stblm 33-37, andre fartygsinsp. i Sthlm 37-41, tekn. aman. i kommerskoll. 41-42, förste byråinsp. v. kommikoll. 42-45, förste fartygsinsp. i Skelikfteå 45, i Kalmar 46. Hoibby: sikytte.
translated: Almquist, Ernst Carl Henning, born first vessel superintendent, Kailmar, born September 19, 1897 in Södertälje county to estate owner Johan A. and Anna Boheman. Married to Else Almgren on the 24th of an unspecified month, with children: Margareta born in 1925, married to pilot J.O. Arman, Birgitta born in 1927, and Styrbjörn born in 1928. He passed his final exams from new oak ISLK in Stockholm in 1915 and graduated from KTH (shipbuilding) in 1920. Employed by Maatschappij Fijenoord in Rotterdam from 1921-1932, then Wilton Fijenoord in Schiedam from 1932-1933. Worked as a marine construction engineer for the navy depot in Stockholm from 1933-1937, became the second vessel inspector in Stockholm from 1937-1941, technical assistant in the commercial college from 1941-1942, first bureau inspector at kommikoll. from 1942-1945, and first vessel inspector in Skelikfteå in 1945 and Kailmar in 1946. His hobby is marksmanship.

structured.name: Ernst Carl Henning Almquist

education.name: Stud:ex. v. nya eikm islk. i St’h’lm 15

structured.description: Ernst Carl Henning Almquist was a Swedish First Vessel Inspector, born on September 19, 1897, in Södertälje, Stockholm County. He was the son of estate owner Johan A. Almquist and Anna Boheman. Ernst was married to Else Almgren and had three children: Margareta, Birgitta, and Styrbjörn. He passed his final exams from new oak ISLK in Stockholm in 1915 and graduated from KTH (shipbuilding) in 1920. Ernst worked for various companies, including Maatschappij Fijenoord and Wilton Fijenoord in the Netherlands, as well as the navy depot in Stockholm. He held several positions, such as Marine Construction Engineer and First Vessel Inspector. Ernst had a hobby of marksmanship.
